design_audit.model_formula: logunits ~ logprice + pr + f + d + brand + vol_eq + producttype + package + flavorscent + fatcontent + cookingmethod + saltsodiumcontent + typeofcut + iri_key_FE + week_FE
design_audit.selection_story: Bajari, Nekipelov, Ryan and Yang (2015) estimate demand for salty snacks using IRI scanner data. The baseline Model 1 is OLS regression of log(units) on log(price) and product/store/week characteristics. This is a demand estimation (prediction) exercise, not a causal identification design. The price elasticity coefficient on logprice is the focal parameter.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Log units sold of salty snack products at store-week level
claim_object.estimand_concept: Own-price elasticity of demand for salty snacks, estimated via OLS with store and time fixed effects and product characteristics
claim_object.target_population: Salty snack (potato chip) products at grocery stores in IRI scanner data, 2001-2006

baseline_specs.label: Model1-OLS-full
baseline_specs.notes: Model 1 in paper: standard OLS with all product characteristics plus store and week FE. No clustering in original paper.

constraints.notes: Controls are categorical product characteristics. Paper compares 9 ML models; our specification search varies the OLS specification across controls, FE, sample, and functional form. Data is proprietary IRI scanner data (not included); we construct synthetic data calibrated to paper description.

canonical.notes: Paper uses standard OLS (iid) SEs for Model 1. Large sample (hundreds of thousands of obs) justifies this choice.

variants.notes: Cluster at store level to account for within-store correlation
Cluster at product level to account for within-product correlation
